It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that often have a silvery underside. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Canalia daphnoides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
